name: drying of grass | drying of grass | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/8348/documentation

The functional unit is kg water evaporated. This module should be used when evaluating production of grass pellets.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



The inventory takes into account the energy demand (supplied by burning light fuel oil and consumption of electricity) for evaporating 1 kg of water, when drying grass (at 110-120°C). Also included in the inventory is the infrastructure (building and machinery). Inventoried outputs are heat waste and air emissions from combustion. Not included are waste and other air emissions (like dust). Production of the wet educt and utilisation of the dried product, are not included.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0163:Post-harvest crop activities

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time of publication in literature and annual reports. Most publications between 2001 and 2002.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventories are based on indications made by drying plants in Switzerland compared partially to values given in international references (Western Europe).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The inventories are based on common grass and maize drying plants.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Values are based partially on non verified measurements, on expert estimations and on international references. This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography CH. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.

exchanges.description:
Estimation based on Swiss plant. A typical Swiss drying plant for grass and maize measures approx. 20 m * 40 m (Christen 2002). This surface is included as "building, hall". Only a minority of the drying plants have a storage building. It was therefore assumed that a typical Swiss grass- and maize-drying plant does not have a storehouse. For "building, hall", a lifetime of 50 years was assumed. The land use for environs needed to deal with tractors and trailers and other vehicles or machines was estimated as 3,000 square meters (area only, material not included (Althaus 2003)), included the 800 m2 of the plant itself (Scheidegger 2002). It was assumed that there was a transformation from "pasture and meadow" occupancy to "industrial area" occupancy.

The capacity utilization rate is 4/12 (4 months per year).

Further References

Personal communication from H.J. Althaus, EMPA Dübendorf, 27 January 2003.
Personal communication from F. Scheidegger, Landi Landshut. Bätterkinden, Switzerland, November 2002.
EcoSpold01Location=CH
